title: How to Install a Coolant Flush Kit

steps.title: Check the engine to make sure it is no longer hot.
steps.content: Check the engine to make sure it is no longer hot. Loosen the radiator cap to release any pressure still left, and then re-tighten. Many newer cars have the cap on the coolant reservoir instead of the radiator itself, but, on certain cars, there may be no radiator cap at all. In this case, emit the pressure by loosening the thermostat cap.

steps.title: Place a pan or bucket under the radiator plug beneath the car to catch the old antifreeze.
steps.content: Place a pan or bucket under the radiator plug beneath the car to catch the old antifreeze. Elevating the car on ramps may help the process. [1] X Research source

steps.title: Splice the "Flush Tee" to the heater inlet hose.
steps.content: Splice the "Flush Tee" to the heater inlet hose. The heater inlet hose usually runs between the firewall and the top of the radiator. This may be done using a clamp and a couple of screws. [2] X Research source

steps.title: Remove the cap covering the tee as well as the radiator cap.
steps.content: Remove the cap covering the tee as well as the radiator cap. Attach a coupler to the flushing tee to prevent backwash. The black part should attach to the tee and the yellow part should attach to a garden hose. On cars with no radiator cap (or reservoir cap), flush by disconnecting the upper radiator hose.

steps.title: Flush with tap water until it runs clear.
steps.content: Flush with tap water until it runs clear. A cleaning solution may have also been provided in the antifreeze flush kit. [3] X Research source

steps.title: Mix antifreeze according to what your climate needs, somewhere between a 50% and 70% mix.
steps.content: Mix antifreeze according to what your climate needs, somewhere between a 50% and 70% mix.

steps.title: Pour the amount you measured into your radiator, reservoir or thermostat opening.
steps.content: Pour the amount you measured into your radiator, reservoir or thermostat opening. Some leakage of water and diluted antifreeze will come out of the tee. [4] X Research source

steps.title: Recap the tee and tighten the clamp by hand.
steps.content: Recap the tee and tighten the clamp by hand. Replace your radiator cap and run your car for 10 minutes after it reaches its running temperature.

steps.title: Allow your engine to cool again and check antifreeze levels.
steps.content: Allow your engine to cool again and check antifreeze levels. Add more as needed. [5] X Research source
